p: There were significant trends between specific biogeochemical parameters and the top 10 Orders of bacteria in the GI sites ( Supplementary Figure 4), however, none of the biogeochemical parameters were consistently correlated across bacterial Orders or GI design. Chromatales and A21b were among the 10 abundant Orders across all GI designs. Chromatales had significant positive correlation ( p < 0.05) with the MC of ETP and SSIS but not VS, while A21b also significantly correlated ( p < 0.05) positively with MC, but only for VS. OM content was high across all GI sites, but only significant ( p < 0.05) twice â€“ positively with Anaerolineales in VS and negatively with Neisseriales in ETP.
